intro: Corniola tenella, commonly known as the lesser tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small yellowish-green flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Corniola tenella is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in damp, well-drained soils.
